content.description: <math alttext="D of t, equals, 10 plus 4.9, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 6, times t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4.9</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>
content.question: The function <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined above models the depth, in feet, of the water <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> hours after 12 A.M. in a certain harbor. Which of the following presents the method for finding the instantaneous rate of change of the depth of the water, in feet per hour, at 6 A.M. ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator D of 6, minus D of 0, and denominator 6 minus 0, end fraction, equals negative 1.633" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>D</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>D</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.63</mn></mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="D double prime of 6, equals 1.343" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1.343</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
